channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Deep learning for predicting the occurrence of tipping points
item.description: The ability to predict the occurrence of tipping points from time series data remains an outstanding challenge and a major interest in a broad range of research fields.

item.title: Multi-Agent Trajectory Prediction with Difficulty-Guided Feature Enhancement Network
item.description: Traditional methods usually perform holistic inference on the trajectories of agents, neglecting the differences in prediction difficulty among agents.

item.title: Do We Really Need Graph Convolution During Training? Light Post-Training Graph-ODE for Efficient Recommendation
item.description: The efficiency and scalability of graph convolution networks (GCNs) in training recommender systems (RecSys) have been persistent concerns, hindering their deployment in real-world applications.

item.title: Adversarial Robustification via Text-to-Image Diffusion Models
item.description: Adversarial robustness has been conventionally believed as a challenging property to encode for neural networks, requiring plenty of training data.

item.title: AppWorld: A Controllable World of Apps and People for Benchmarking Interactive Coding Agents
item.description: To remedy this gap, we built $\textbf{AppWorld Engine}$, a high-quality execution environment (60K lines of code) of 9 day-to-day apps operable via 457 APIs and populated with realistic digital activities simulating the lives of ~100 fictitious users.

item.title: Enhancing Dysarthric Speech Recognition for Unseen Speakers via Prototype-Based Adaptation
item.description: To address this issue, we introduce a prototype-based approach that markedly improves DSR performance for unseen dysarthric speakers without additional fine-tuning.

item.title: ReALFRED: An Embodied Instruction Following Benchmark in Photo-Realistic Environments
item.description: To bridge the gap between these learning environments and deploying (i. e., real) environments, we propose the ReALFRED benchmark that employs real-world scenes, objects, and room layouts to learn agents to complete household tasks by understanding free-form language instructions and interacting with objects in large, multi-room and 3D-captured scenes.

item.title: Knowledge Graph Structure as Prompt: Improving Small Language Models Capabilities for Knowledge-based Causal Discovery
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the capabilities of Small Language Models (SLMs, defined as LLMs with fewer than 1 billion parameters) with prompt-based learning for knowledge-based causal discovery.

item.title: VSSD: Vision Mamba with Non-Casual State Space Duality
item.description: Recently, State Space Duality (SSD), an improved variant of SSMs, was introduced in Mamba2 to enhance model performance and efficiency.

item.title: Benchmarking Dependence Measures to Prevent Shortcut Learning in Medical Imaging
item.description: Medical imaging cohorts are often confounded by factors such as acquisition devices, hospital sites, patient backgrounds, and many more.

item.title: SMPISD-MTPNet: Scene Semantic Prior-Assisted Infrared Ship Detection Using Multi-Task Perception Networks
item.description: To address these challenges, we propose the Scene Semantic Prior-Assisted Multi-Task Perception Network (SMPISD-MTPNet), which includes three stages: scene semantic extraction, deep feature extraction, and prediction.

item.title: Fairness Definitions in Language Models Explained
item.description: Specifically, we begin with a brief introduction to LMs and fairness in LMs, followed by a comprehensive, up-to-date overview of existing fairness notions in LMs and the introduction of a novel taxonomy that categorizes these concepts based on their foundational principles and operational distinctions.

item.title: Is larger always better? Evaluating and prompting large language models for non-generative medical tasks
item.description: The use of Large Language Models (LLMs) in medicine is growing, but their ability to handle both structured Electronic Health Record (EHR) data and unstructured clinical notes is not well-studied.

item.title: Boosting Cross-Domain Point Classification via Distilling Relational Priors from 2D Transformers
item.description: Semantic pattern of an object point cloud is determined by its topological configuration of local geometries.

item.title: A Role-specific Guided Large Language Model for Ophthalmic Consultation Based on Stylistic Differentiation
item.description: Ophthalmology consultations are crucial for diagnosing, treating, and preventing eye diseases.

item.title: A Universal Prompting Strategy for Extracting Process Model Information from Natural Language Text using Large Language Models
item.description: Over the past decade, extensive research efforts have been dedicated to the extraction of information from textual process descriptions.

item.title: A Flexible and Scalable Approach for Collecting Wildlife Advertisements on the Web
item.description: Furthermore, given that the volume of data is staggering, we need scalable mechanisms to acquire, filter, and store the ads, as well as to make them available for analysis.

item.title: MOoSE: Multi-Orientation Sharing Experts for Open-set Scene Text Recognition
item.description: In this work, we first propose a Multi-Oriented Open-Set Text Recognition task (MOOSTR) to model the challenges of both novel characters and writing direction variety.

item.title: Small Molecule Optimization with Large Language Models
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models have opened new possibilities for generative molecular drug design.

item.title: HybridDepth: Robust Depth Fusion for Mobile AR by Leveraging Depth from Focus and Single-Image Priors
item.description: Through comprehensive quantitative and qualitative analyses, we demonstrate that HYBRIDDEPTH not only outperforms state-of-the-art (SOTA) models in common datasets (DDFF12, NYU Depth v2) and a real-world AR dataset ARKitScenes but also demonstrates strong zero-shot generalization.

item.title: Dual-Decoupling Learning and Metric-Adaptive Thresholding for Semi-Supervised Multi-Label Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose a dual-perspective method to generate high-quality pseudo-labels.

item.title: Reshape Dimensions Network for Speaker Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we present Reshape Dimensions Network (ReDimNet), a novel neural network architecture for extracting utterance-level speaker representations.

item.title: Detection of manatee vocalisations using the Audio Spectrogram Transformer
item.description: We propose a novel end-to-end approach to detect manatee vocalisations building on the Audio Spectrogram Transformer (AST).

item.title: Sparse vs Contiguous Adversarial Pixel Perturbations in Multimodal Models: An Empirical Analysis
item.description: Our attacks target less than 0. 04% of perturbed image area and integrate different spatial positioning of perturbed pixels: sparse positioning and pixels arranged in different contiguous shapes (row, column, diagonal, and patch).

item.title: Segmentation by registration-enabled SAM prompt engineering using five reference images
item.description: This approach utilises established image registration algorithms to align the new image (to-be-segmented) and a small number of reference images, without requiring segmentation labels.

item.title: Investigating learning-independent abstract reasoning in artificial neural networks
item.description: However, assuming a similarity between the cognitive processing of Artificial Neural Networks (ANNs) and humans, the extent to which training is required for ANNs' abstract reasoning is informative about this question in humans.

item.title: Move and Act: Enhanced Object Manipulation and Background Integrity for Image Editing
item.description: However, these methods lack control over the generation position of the edited object and have issues with background preservation.

item.title: RefMask3D: Language-Guided Transformer for 3D Referring Segmentation
item.description: 3D referring segmentation is an emerging and challenging vision-language task that aims to segment the object described by a natural language expression in a point cloud scene.

item.title: FADAS: Towards Federated Adaptive Asynchronous Optimization
item.description: Federated learning (FL) has emerged as a widely adopted training paradigm for privacy-preserving machine learning.

item.title: KiVA: Kid-inspired Visual Analogies for Testing Large Multimodal Models
item.description: This paper investigates visual analogical reasoning in large multimodal models (LMMs) compared to human adults and children.

item.title: AsEP: Benchmarking Deep Learning Methods for Antibody-specific Epitope Prediction
item.description: AsEP comes with an easy-to-use interface in Python and pre-built graph representations of each antibody-antigen complex while also supporting customizable embedding methods.

item.title: The Dark Side of Function Calling: Pathways to Jailbreaking Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities, but their power comes with significant security considerations.

item.title: Multi-Resolution Histopathology Patch Graphs for Ovarian Cancer Subtyping
item.description: However, this only exceeded the performance of attention-based multiple instance learning in external validation, with a 93% balanced accuracy.

item.title: LION: Linear Group RNN for 3D Object Detection in Point Clouds
item.description: To tackle this problem, we simply introduce a 3D spatial feature descriptor and integrate it into the linear group RNN operators to enhance their spatial features rather than blindly increasing the number of scanning orders for voxel features.

item.title: Self-Supervision Improves Diffusion Models for Tabular Data Imputation
item.description: Additionally, the sparsity inherent in tabular data poses challenges for diffusion models in accurately modeling the data manifold, impacting the robustness of these models for data imputation.

item.title: Simulation of Neural Responses to Classical Music Using Organoid Intelligence Methods
item.description: Organoid intelligence and deep learning models show promise for simulating and analyzing these neural responses to classical music, an area significantly unexplored in computational neuroscience.

item.title: Physics-informed nonlinear vector autoregressive models for the prediction of dynamical systems
item.description: Machine learning techniques have recently been of great interest for solving differential equations.

item.title: Scaling Training Data with Lossy Image Compression
item.description: In order to capture this trade-off and optimize storage of training data, we propose a `storage scaling law' that describes the joint evolution of test error with sample size and number of bits per image.

item.title: Numerical Literals in Link Prediction: A Critical Examination of Models and Datasets
item.description: We propose a methodology to evaluate LP models that incorporate numerical literals.

item.title: PEFT-U: Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning for User Personalization
item.description: Using PEFT-U, we explore the challenge of efficiently personalizing LLMs to accommodate user-specific preferences in the context of diverse user-centered tasks.

item.title: Harnessing Temporal Causality for Advanced Temporal Action Detection
item.description: As a fundamental task in long-form video understanding, temporal action detection (TAD) aims to capture inherent temporal relations in untrimmed videos and identify candidate actions with precise boundaries.

item.title: Unsupervised Training of Neural Cellular Automata on Edge Devices
item.description: The disparity in access to machine learning tools for medical imaging across different regions significantly limits the potential for universal healthcare innovation, particularly in remote areas.

item.title: Invariance of deep image quality metrics to affine transformations
item.description: This methodology involves transforming the distance measured by an arbitrary metric to a common distance representation based on available subjectively rated databases.

item.title: Text-Driven Neural Collaborative Filtering Model for Paper Source Tracing
item.description: Identifying significant references within the complex interrelations of a citation knowledge graph is challenging, which encompasses connections through citations, authorship, keywords, and other relational attributes.

item.title: Joint RGB-Spectral Decomposition Model Guided Image Enhancement in Mobile Photography
item.description: The integration of miniaturized spectrometers into mobile devices offers new avenues for image quality enhancement and facilitates novel downstream tasks.

item.title: MapTune: Advancing ASIC Technology Mapping via Reinforcement Learning Guided Library Tuning
item.description: The effectiveness of MapTune is evaluated on a wide range of benchmarks, different technology libraries and technology mappers.

item.title: LoRA-Pro: Are Low-Rank Adapters Properly Optimized?
item.description: Our method constrains the optimization process, shrinking the performance gap between LoRA and full fine-tuning.

item.title: Multi-Stage Face-Voice Association Learning with Keynote Speaker Diarization
item.description: In this paper, we propose a ``Multi-stage Face-voice Association Learning with Keynote Speaker Diarization''~(MFV-KSD) framework.

item.title: Weighted Risk Invariance: Domain Generalization under Invariant Feature Shift
item.description: Invariant models are also supposed to generalize to shifts in the marginal distribution $p(X_{\text{inv}})$ of the extracted features $X_{\text{inv}}$, a type of shift we call an $\textit{invariant covariate shift}$.

item.title: Automatic Data Labeling for Software Vulnerability Prediction Models: How Far Are We?
item.description: Background: Software Vulnerability (SV) prediction needs large-sized and high-quality data to perform well.
